meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #4479.

td.p: Oliver Sherouse, a junior from Montgomery, Alabama
Kerry Lambeth, a senior from Tualitin, Oregon
Meghan Apfelbaum, a senior from Menands, New York

tr.td: WORLD CAPITALS
SPORTS MASCOTS
FASCINATING BIBLE FACTS
BABY IT'S COLD OUTSIDE
AMERICAN WOMEN
HOLIDAYS & OBSERVANCES

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: If you put the year together with the place, you should\'ve come up with the correct response.)
...
(Alex: [To Meghan] Our national anthem, you are correct; associated with the War of 1812.)
...
(Alex: [To Kerry] She gave it to us in two forms, and she\'s right and earns $1,999. She goes up to $14,999.)
...
(Alex: [To Oliver] He will be the semifinalist with... oh boy, $9,001; $26,001 for him as he becomes a semifinalist, and Kerry and Meghan, with those scores, I\'ve a feeling we\'ll see both of you next week also; but it all depends on what happens tomorrow. We\'ll find out in our last quarterfinal match on Jeopardy! See you then.)
MeghanWhat is The Star Spangled Banner?
$6,000
KerryWhat is the national anthem? (Star-Spangled Banner)
$1,999
OliverWhat is The Star Spang Spangled Banner?
$9,001
\"The Star-Spangled Banner\"')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'One of the first to sing it publicly was Baltimore actor Fredinand Durang at Captain McCauley\'s tavern in October 1814')

tr.td: SONGS
One of the first to sing it publicly was Baltimore actor Fredinand Durang at Captain McCauley's tavern in October 1814
Meghan
Kerry
Oliver
3rd place: $2,500 if eliminated
2nd place: $2,500 if eliminated
Automatic semifinalist
Meghan
Kerry
Oliver

13 R,
1 W
(including 1 DD)

21 R
(including 1 DD),
6 W
(including 1 DD)
